posts.cooked: Hi yall, this is team 9172 of the first robotics competition, and we are having trouble trying to configure our roboRIO we’re not sure if its been updated already or we just cant be allowed to updated The update firmware is greyed out and we dont know what to do since we have already tried the troubleshooting from the manual

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
You have to flash the SD card on a roboRIO 2. Check the docs:

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: Hello, thank you for the advice, we checked the documents & we even flashed the sd card but we are still at a road block and the update firmware is still greyed out. Did we do something wrong?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You only need to set the team number.  Select edit startup settings.

Hello we did as you said and we got an error message

“ni system configuration: timeout while waiting for restart. the system is offline”

We’re not sure what to do, and our roborio status is blinking orange consistently. We looked up the issue for it blinking consistent and the answer was there is unrecoverable files on it

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Try reimaging the SD card with a different tool (there are two common ones, balena etcher and rPi imager).
Hello, so our main issue now is roborio can’t be selected since it is blinking orange consistently and we have no way on stopping it, what can we do to fix this?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Turn off the Rio, pull out the SD card, reimage the SD card, and try again.

We tried to turn off the RoboRIO, pulled out the SD card, and reimaged it using raspberry pi instead of BalenaEtcher this time. However, we still are seeing a continous blinking light on the RoboRIO indicating it is an unrecoverable error. Do you have any other thoughts on what we can do? Thanks.

We were able to get the SD card reimaged. However, we’re still not able to select the image (it appears greyed out as shown in the original message) even after editing the startup settings with our team number.

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
You don’t want or need to select the image in the roboRIO Imaging Tool for a rio 2.0. You said you already got the SD card imaged following the directions.

The Rio 2.0 doesn’t use the Imaging Tool for that.

Oh, I think I understand. Thank you for the help. However, we are not able to “update firmware” as it says in the original message. It just shows up greyed out. Do you know why? Or how we can update the firmware?

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked: The RIO 2 doesn’t have any writable/updateable parts aside from the SD card. So, the RIO 2 keeps the firmware that it was shipped with.

So, the RIO 2 keeps the firmware that it was shipped with.
